articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Hyong Jik
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kim Hyong Jik, indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, in Ponghwa-ri, Kangdong County, and his grave in Mangyongdae on Sunday, the 90th anniversary of his demise.
					 Seen before the statue and grave were wreaths sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremonies were Ri Su Yong, Kwak Pom Gi, Ro Tu Chol and No Kwang Chol and the chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Social Democratic Party, officials of the party and armed forces bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, working people and schoolchildren.
					
					 Laid before the statue and grave were a wreath in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Also laid there were wreaths in the name of the working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, revolutionary schools and educational institutions, and party and power organs, enterprises and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Hyong Jik.
					
					 Wreaths and bouquets were also placed before his statues in Sakju and Junggang counties on the same day.

articles.title: Senior Officials Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Senior Officials Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Mt. Paektu
 Samjiyon, June 5 (KCNA) -- Leading officials of the state and army, officials of the party and armed forces organs, Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions toured the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the study tour of revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu.
					 They laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the Samjiyon Grand Monument and paid tribute to him.
					
					 They visited the Samjiyon Revolutionary Museum on Saturday and looked round the photos of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and the historical materials on display there, being briefed on their exploits and those of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They visited Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp and looked round the historical relics preserved there. And they laid bouquets before the mosaic depicting the three commanders of Mt. Paektu there and made a bow.
					
					 They also toured the Sajabong secret camp, the Pegaebong Bivouac, Samtogong log cabin where Kim Jong Il spent a night with members of the expedition group on June 9, Juche 45 (1956), and several places of the lodging quarters of visitors to the Samjiyon Revolutionary Battle Site built as a camping place of the visitors.
					
					 They climbed Mt. Paektu after going round the Mudubong secret camp on June 5.

articles.title: More Provincial Rallies Vow to Become Victors in 200-day Campaign
articles.content:
More Provincial Rallies Vow to Become Victors in 200-day Campaign
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- There took place mass rallies in North Phyongan, Kangwon and North Hamgyong provinces on Saturday and Sunday to vow to successfully implement the decision made at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and become honorable victors in the 200-day campaign.
					 Present there were officials of the local party, power and economic organs, working people's organizations, industrial establishments, farms and universities, working people and youths and students.
					
					 Reports were made there to be followed by speeches of the representatives of workers, agricultural workers, youths and intellectuals.
					
					 The reporters and speakers said that all officials, party members and other working people are full of enthusiasm to become honorable victors again in the 200-day campaign in the wake of the 70-day campaign of loyalty.
					
					 They called on all officials, party members and other working people to turn out as one in the struggle to carry out the decision of the Party Seventh Congress, bearing in minds the militant call of the party for the 200-day campaign.
					
					 They underscored the need to go all out to become victors in the 200-day campaign for implementing the decision advanced at the Party Seventh Congress.
					
					 The rallies were followed by demonstrations.

articles.title: Anniversary of Ponghwari Revolutionary Museum Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Ponghwari Revolutionary Museum Marked
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Ponghwari Revolutionary Museum marked its 50th anniversary.
					 The museum is the place where Kim Hyong Jik, father of President Kim Il Sung and indomitable revolutionary fighter, hewed out the untrodden path of the history, regarding it as the headquarters of the Korean National Association and base of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement of Korea and a powerful base of educating the masses.
					
					 The President visited Ponghwa-ri on April 10, Juche 55 (1966), recalled the revolutionary activities of Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok, mother of the President, and ascertained historical materials one after another. He gave field guidance to it more than 10 times to teach the principled issues arising in the preservation of the revolutionary relics.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il made sure that the revolutionary museum was built into the base of studying the revolutionary activities of Kim Hyong Jik and the base of educating the masses and personally named it. And he also went to the spot several times and solved problems arising in the work of preserving and managing the historical site.
					
					 The revolutionary museum has carried out the revolutionary duty in a responsible way as the place which tells about the career and revolutionary feats of Kim Hyong Jik, outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, during the past 50 years since its foundation on June 5, 1966.
					
					 A meeting to mark the anniversary took place on Sunday.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, officials and employees of the museum.
					
					 A congratulatory message of the WPK Central Committee to the employees and officials of the museum was conveyed there.
					
					 A report was made to be followed by speeches.

articles.title: Ponghwa Revolutionary Site Visited by Many People
articles.content:
Ponghwa Revolutionary Site Visited by Many People
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Many service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children from more than 56 400 organizations of the DPRK visited the Ponghwari Revolutionary Museum since it was built on June 5, Juche 55 (1966). The museum tells about the revolutionary activities of Kim Hyong Jik, indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement of Korea.
					 The participants looked round various places of the Ponghwa revolutionary site and learned about his revolutionary career and feats.
					
					 They looked back upon the great traits of the ardent patriot and great revolutionary before his statue. 
					
					 They went round a house, the place on Mt. Ponghwa where a secret meeting was held, Monument to Pisok-gye and Maekjon Ferry.
					
					 In Myongsin School, they recalled the viewpoint on the younger generation of Kim Hyong Jik who brought up students to be able men for the independence of the country and pillars of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 They looked round historical mementoes and materials at the Ponghwari Revolutionary Museum while being briefed on the fact that he formed the Korean National Association on March 23, 1917 at Hakdang-gol in Pyongyang and conducted energetic activities to expand its organizations to the vast areas at home and abroad.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Angolan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Angolan President
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a congratulatory message from Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola on May 16.
					 The president in the message congratulated Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the WPK on behalf of the Angolan government and on his own behalf.
					
					 Convinced that Kim Jong Un's election to the top post of the WPK was the reflection of the desire of all the members of the WPK and other people in the DPRK, the Angolan president wished him happiness and successes in the noble work for peace, stability, development and prosperity of the DPRK.
					
					 The president reaffirmed the will of the Angolan government to continuously boost the historical ties of friendship and cooperation between Angola and the DPRK.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people progress.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued a new stamp (individual) on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 Printed on the upper part of the stamp are letters "70th Anniversary of KCU," "Juche 35 (1946)" and "Juche 105 (2016)" which reminds one of the proud course of development covered by the KCU as a Juche-oriented children's organization under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Depicted in the center of the stamp is bright and brave looks of KCU members growing up to be dependable pillars of a socialist power, together with letters "Become Pillars Supporting a Prosperous Future Korea".

articles.title: Japan's Future Depends on Sincere Liquidation of Its Past: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Future Depends on Sincere Liquidation of Its Past: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the chief Cabinet secretary of Japan blustered the DPRK's claim that Japan should reflect and apologize for the past crimes is unilateral and unacceptable. He also made ridiculous rigmarole that the DPRK's denuclearization should precede.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This assertion just clearly proves the Japanese reactionaries' impudence and moral vulgarity.
					
					 What is more enraging is that Japan is finding fault with the DPRK over the issue which has nothing to do with the liquidation of its past.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear weapons is not a political bargaining chip and, furthermore, it is not an issue that Japan is entitled to talk about. This being a hard reality, Japan asserts that if the DPRK fails to denuclearize itself first, it will not discuss the settlement of the past. 
					
					 Japan's intention is clear. Its aim is to evade the past liquation at any cost under the pretext of the DPRK's nuclear issue. The chief Cabinet secretary's remark is an expression of sinister intention of the Japanese reactionaries to bury the stark history of aggression and plunder of Korea into oblivion, and an extension of the acts to do so.
					
					 The crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against the Korean nation can never be written off and justified.
					
					 The only way out for Japan to live as a member of the international community is to make an apology and reparation for its past wrongdoings.
					
					 There will be no future for Japan without this.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye Denounced for Slandering DPRK Again
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Denounced for Slandering DPRK Again
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye slandered the DPRK again during her visits to African countries shortly ago. Wherever she went, she talked such boring rubbish that "nuclear development" of the DPRK is "a serious threat to the world peace" and "it should never be allowed".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a commentary says that this is a revelation of her sordid nature as a maniac keen on doing harm to the fellow countrymen in collusion with outsiders.
					
					 No matter how desperately the south Korean conservative forces may resort to the racket for escalating confrontation with the DPRK in collusion with outsiders, they can neither tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK nor check the dynamic advance of the service personnel and people along the road of independence, Songun and socialism and get out of the worst crisis, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 It is foolhardy for Park to try to do harm to the DPRK, dignified thanks to independence and strong thanks to Songun politics, through mendicant diplomacy with outsiders.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' conspiracy racket for isolating and stifling the DPRK in collusion with outsiders will only bring them curse and denunciation by all the Koreans and the shame before the world eyes.
					
					 If the south Korean chief executive continues provocative vituperation against the DPRK, she will never be able to evade miserable fate as confrontational maniac and traitor to the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns Anti-Reunification Forces
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns Anti-Reunification Forces
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in an article that the south Korean authorities should halt their imprudent confrontation acts which is only hastening their own ruin through foolish misjudgment while going against the patriotic call of the DPRK. 
					 The paper goes on:
					
					 Now the inter-Korean relations hit the lowest ebb just because the south Korean authorities are going mad with confrontation rackets against the DPRK while getting extremely hostile to the fellow countrymen.
					
					 But considering the inter-Korean relations and nation's destiny much dearer, we laid aside all the inglorious things that happened up to date by displaying patience and tolerance and appealed to the south Korean authorities to break the deadlock between the north and south through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 Various circles of south Korea as well as overseas Koreans are expressing support and approval to our patriotic decision and demanding the south Korean authorities make a responsible option.
					
					 Nevertheless, they, who are short-sighted and obsessed with abnormal concept of confrontation, have taken a provocative attitude, far from thanking us for our sincerity for improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The DPRK proposed dialogue with the south Korean authorities, prompted by its heavy responsibility before the nation to tide over the grave confrontational state and pave the way to reunification.
					
					 It is the dirty act of those displeased with the improvement of the north-south relations and reunification that they branded the proposal as "tactics" or something like that.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the ways of removing misunderstanding and mistrust and promoting confidence and unity.
					
					 Those keen on confrontation against reunification while going against the trend of the times and the desire of the nation will be forced to pay a dear price.

articles.title: Setting up of "Foundation" for Covering up Japan's Past Crimes Flailed
articles.content:
Setting up of "Foundation" for Covering up Japan's Past Crimes Flailed
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- More than 30 organizations in Pusan held a press conference outside the Japanese Consulate in Pusan on June 1 against the puppet group's establishment of the "Foundation" for covering up the crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists.
					 The speakers at the press conference said that the establishment of the preparatory committee for setting up the "Foundation" by the authorities is pursuant to the scenario to step up the implementation of the "agreement" which they cooked up with Japan in a shackling way without any heed paid to the victims of sexual slavery.
					
					 The south Korean civic and social circles and even the human rights experts of the UN are denouncing the "agreement" as an attempt to gag victims and write off the history with money, they noted.
					
					 They declared the "agreement", which covered up the crimes of the Japanese imperialists for a few pennies against the will of the victims of sexual slavery who demand sincere apology and reparation, null and void and demanded an immediate stop to the setting up of the "Foundation".

articles.title: South Korean Puppet Forces Keen on Stifling Fellow Countrymen in Collusion with Outsiders
articles.content:
South Korean Puppet Forces Keen on Stifling Fellow Countrymen in Collusion with Outsiders 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet warmongers plan to take part in the U.S.-led RIMPAC joint military exercises with an aim at naval blockade against the DPRK, according to Kyunghyang Daily News of south Korea.
					 To this end, a large number of troops including special warfare corps and marine corps and destroyers, submarines, sea-patrol planes, helicopters and many other military hardware of the puppet navy departed for the designated waters on June 2.
					
					 The largest-ever joint drills to be held in waters around Hawaii till August 4 will involve joint drill of the U.S., Japan and south Korea to counter ballistic missile "threat" from the DPRK.
					
					 There will also be missile launch drill, landing drill, anti-submarine drill, anti-aircraft drill and other drills for attack as well as sea blockade exercises.
					
					 What is noteworthy is that before the start of the joint military drill a destroyer of the puppet navy is going to stage missile warning drill for sharing missile data with the U.S. and Japanese warships through a relay station of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces.
					
					 The drill assumes more dangerous nature given the fact that the triangular missile defence system is becoming the starting point of the triangular military alliance that invites protest and denunciation of the public at home and abroad.

articles.title: Successful WPK Seventh Congress Hailed by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Successful WPK Seventh Congress Hailed by Koreans in China 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Yanbian Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China held a meeting in Yanji on May 30 to congratulate supreme leader Kim Jong Un's election as chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The meeting heard the report by Cha Sang Bo, vice chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, who had participated in the congress as the head of its delegation to congratulate the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 He said that Kim Jong Un made sure that he took the tribune of honor at the congress and read out the congratulatory message of the General Association of Koreans in China. Kim Jong Un also personally watched a congratulatory banner reflecting the loyalty of all Koreans in China and expressed concern about the health of the chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, he noted.
					
					 Referring to the love and care for his delegation during the visit to the homeland, he stressed that Kim Jong Un is the benevolent father of all the Koreans in China.
					
					 Cha called for building up the general association founded and developed under the care of the great leaders into Kim Jong Un's overseas citizens organization in which his monolithic leadership system is firmly established through the successful holding of the 6th congress of the general association this year.
					
					 The participants in the meeting studied the line and policies for national reunification Kim Jong Un set forth at the Party Seventh Congress.
					
					 On the same day, they watched videos such as "The Seventh Congress of the WPK, one of victory and glory to be recorded in the history of the great Kimilsungist-Kimjongilist party, opened with splendor", etc.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Making Selfless, Devoted Efforts for the Good of the People is the Mode of Existence and Source of Invincible Might of the Workers' Party of Korea" was brought out in booklet with due ceremony on May 24 by the Penguin Publishing House in Ethiopia on the occasion of the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The work, published on October 10, Juche 104 (2015), says that the history of the WPK is a proud course in which it has taken care of the people's destiny in a responsible manner and led the Korean revolution to victory under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Ethiopian Figure Praises WPK
articles.content:
Ethiopian Figure Praises WPK 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) has won the dignity as the most powerful party in the world as it shares the same destiny with the popular masses.
					 The manager of the Penguin Publishing House in Ethiopia said this at the releasing ceremony of Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Making Selfless, Devoted Efforts for the Good of the People is the Mode of Existence and Source of Invincible Might of the Workers' Party of Korea" on May 24.
					
					 The manager noted:
					
					 It is the manifestation of the absolute trust of the Korean people that Kim Jong Un was elected chairman of WPK at the Seventh Congress of the WPK held amid the great attention of the world.
					
					 The WPK has relied on the popular masses counting on their strength and worked hard to meet their interests over 70 years.
					
					 He wished the Korean people greater success in the struggle to carry out the important tasks set forth at the party congress.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Studied in Austria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Studied in Austria 
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- There took place a seminar on the work of Marshal Kim Jong Un "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" in Austria on May 30 to mark the 52nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Present at the seminar were members of the Youth Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Austria.
					
					 The chief of the group and other speakers said that the WPK has developed into the one which organizes and guides all the victories of the Korean people and motherly party since Kim Jong Il started his work at the Central Committee of the WPK.
					
					 They expressed belief that the WPK led by its Chairman Kim Jong Un will as ever vigorously struggle to build a socialist power and achieve independent reunification of the country and global independence under the uplifted banner of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism for all ages.
					
					 They renewed their will to widely introduce the proud history of the WPK which has won one victory after another under the leadership of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and conduct more vigorous activities for studying and disseminating Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 Meanwhile, the group studied the report made by Kim Jong Un on the review of the work of the WPK Central Committee at its Seventh Congress.

articles.title: Successful Congress of WPK Celebrated in Russia, Nigeria
articles.content:
Successful Congress of WPK Celebrated in Russia, Nigeria
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- There took place a lecture in Volgograd of Russia and book exhibition in Enugu State of Nigeria on May 26 and 31 in celebration of the successful Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 On display at the venues of the events were the poster symbolic of the WPK and books introducing the service personnel and people of the DPRK in their efforts to open up the greatest heyday for building a socialist power.
					
					 Present at the events were personages and the masses in those countries.
					
					 Taysaev, secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, and other speakers warmly congratulated the successful Seventh Congress of the WPK.
					
					 They highly praised the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is victoriously leading the building of a socialist power by successfully carrying forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They admired the superiority and invincibility of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses and hoped that the service personnel and people of the DPRK will achieve big successes in the drive for implementing the decision of the Seventh Congress of the WPK.
					
					 Speakers at the event held in Nigeria extended the highest glory and warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his election as chairman of the WPK reflecting the unanimous will of the Korean people.
					
					 A congratulatory message was adopted at the lecture in Russia.

articles.title: Ecuadorian Bodies Denounce S. Korean Authorities' Abduction of Citizens of DPRK
articles.content:
Ecuadorian Bodies Denounce S. Korean Authorities' Abduction of Citizens of DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the Guaranda Association for Friendship, Culture and Solidarity with the Korean People of Ecuador on May 28 made public a joint statement denouncing the south Korean authorities' inhumane crime.
					 The statement said the unheard-of crime of group abduction of citizens of the DPRK in broad daylight was the extra-large terrorist act which could be committed only by the present south Korean authorities obsessed with extreme confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 The abduction was the premeditated and organized plot by the south Korean puppets against the DPRK and the crime violating the sovereignty of the DPRK and wantonly abusing human rights, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 We, together with the world progressive people, bitterly denounce and reject the inhumane crime of the south Korean puppets and strongly demand the repatriation of the abductees without delay.
					
					 The United Nations and other international bodies should take measures to call into question the despicable crime of the south Korean authorities and force them to send back at once the abductees to their families and stop provocations aggravating the situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity we would like to extend full support and solidarity to the DPRK struggling to smash sanctions and moves of the U.S. and its followers to stifle the DPRK and defend sovereignty and dignity of the country and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Respond to DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Respond to DPRK's Proposal
 Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website an article supporting the open letter of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK on May 26.
					 The article said that the world is greatly moved by the patriotic idea and lines for putting an end to the tragic sufferings of the nation caused by the separation and confrontation and achieving independent and peaceful reunification set forth by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Noting that the proposal for the north-south military authorities' talks is the most realistic way for peace of the country and security of the Korean nation, the article went on:
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities totally deny and reject the proposal while branding it as "propaganda offensive devoid of sincerity" and "camouflaged peace tactics."
					
					 The south Korean authorities should immediately respond to the proposal of the DPRK to jointly pave the way of building military confidence after ending all hostile acts, a stumbling block fostering mistrust and confrontation and hindering the improvement of relations between the north and the south.
					
					 They should stop all the hostile acts irritating and slandering the north including psychological warfare such as broadcasting and leaflet-scattering.
					
					 They should accept the proposal of the DPRK to defuse military tensions on the Korean peninsula and open at an early date the north-south military talks for solving all the problems arising in improving the north-south relations.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should part with the inglorious past and make a fresh start.
